timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: 18 witnesses testify before St. Dié court

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: First interrogation, admits temptation by two men in black

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, admits sabbat attendance and names Jean Blaise

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: Procureur d'office for chapter requests torture with moderation suitable to her age

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: Tortured on rack, confesses to multiple malefices and names accomplices

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees, subject to reinterrogation without duress

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
timeline.details: Final interrogation without duress, repeats confessions, asks to be executed

timeline.subject: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy

torture.restrictions: with moderation suitable to her age

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
notable_quotes.french: que le bruict couroit que l'on la vouloit apprehender pour une sorciere, mais que sy on la prenoit pour telle l'on en prendroit encor bien d'autres
notable_quotes.english: that rumor was circulating that they wanted to arrest her as a witch, but that if they took her as such they would take many others as well
notable_quotes.context: Statement made 3 weeks before arrest, reported by witness 2

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
notable_quotes.french: Que sy elle estoit sorciere c'estoit à faulte de pretres
notable_quotes.english: That if she was a witch it was the fault of the priests
notable_quotes.context: Repeated statement about priestly responsibility for witchcraft, multiple witnesses

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
notable_quotes.french: Que sy elle estoit sorciere cela ne provenoit de sa faulte mais plustost du prebtre qui ne l'auroit pas bien baptisée
notable_quotes.english: That if she was a witch it was not her fault but rather the priest who did not baptize her properly
notable_quotes.context: Variant of statement blaming priests, reported by witness 7

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
notable_quotes.french: Qu'elle n'avoit rien que ce qu'elle avoit meritée
notable_quotes.english: That she had nothing but what she deserved
notable_quotes.context: Angry reply when sympathetic remark made as she left sick woman's chamber, reported by Gregoire Jean Don to witness 4

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
notable_quotes.french: Et prie pour l'honneur dieu qu'on la fasse mourir le plustost qu'il sera possible pour le salut de son ame, et qu'elle vouldroit qu'il ny ait plus de sorciers ny sorcieres au monde, qu'elle soit la derniere Affin que les biens de dessus la terre viennent a plus grand perfection qu'ils ne sont, et que tant et sy longtemps qu'il y en aura que ce sera ung grand malheur pour le pauvre peuple. Et sur ce a prié d'avoir ung bon confesseur pour faire le salut de son ame, et prie a tout ceulx qu'elle a offencés de luy vouloir pardonner.
notable_quotes.english: And prays for the honor of God that they execute her as soon as possible for the salvation of her soul, and that she wishes there were no more witches in the world, that she be the last so that the goods of the earth come to greater perfection than they are, and that as long as there are any it will be a great misfortune for the poor people. And she has prayed to have a good confessor for the salvation of her soul, and prays all those she has offended to forgive her.

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes arose from economic tensions: pigs damaging Claudatte's garden, oak damaging her roof, requests for food and clothing denied. Claudatte's extreme poverty (living on alms, no animals) appears central to community tensions.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is comprehensive with detailed witness testimony. 18 witnesses provide extensive evidence of alleged harms spanning 30 years. Claudatte's confession obtained under torture follows standard demonological patterns. Notable for her statements blaming priests for witchcraft and her final plea to be executed quickly. Economic desperation clearly central to case.
